Posts.Content: May 19, 2017 01:39PM Radmonkey wrote: Thank you so much for everyone posting their first experience. I've done all the research that I can and I'm going to try to enjoy the weekend with my kids. I'm going to be in warrior mode next week. My appt time is Wednesday 12:15 pm. I figure I will be done just in time for rush hour traffic. I'm bringing a bucket for the car ride just in case. Parakeets rule - my port access is below my collarbone, but there is a small tube that connects from the triangular portion that runs over the collarbone that you can see and feel as it dives down into the jugular vein in the neck. It's like a tiny worm under the skin. I find myself rubbing it all the time. Is that what you are referring to? I also asked for Ativan for home based on suggestions here. I took one for the first time last night (because I didn't know how it would effect me on chemo day). Oh, it's so nice.... L
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2017 ParakeetsRule notanisland

Posts.Content: May 5, 2017 05:13PM Radmonkey wrote: Hi. Joining the May 2017 Chemo. Starting the week of May 22. Don't know which day. I will be AC x 4 and T x 4. I'm still in a bit of shock. I get an echocardiogram on Monday. I scheduled my port for this Tuesday. I'm worried about the SE, especially the nausea and vomiting. I throw up with most antibiotics. I'm hoping the port will be healed when I puke my guts out. Sorry, I'm really sad today. I tried on wigs yesterday and they were very "wiggy" on me. Plus, just having it on for 5 minutes, it was really hot. I don't think I will be able to go to my kid activities with one on. Privacy is so important to me. I got that "sad look" from another mother and just started bawling. I am glad that we have this forum. I don't feel so alone in all of this. Is Biotene mouth spray over the counter? Getting Ginger tea today. *HUGS* L

What is the Neulasta pod? I'll be getting that shot. She told me I needed Zyrtec and Zantac but did not tell me about a "pod". Lovepugs77 - Please let me know how it goes. I'll be right behind you.

Posts.Content: May 9, 2017 07:32PM - edited May 9, 2017 11:14PM by Radmonkey Port done. I keep singing, "Shot through the heart..." by Bon Jovi. It's uncomfortable (but not like my bilateral mastectomies)... I was awake the entire time, a little pushing and pulling but not too bad. It is sore to move my arm or neck. I guess it will be a lazy day. It's just one step closer to chemo... Ok update. I think the lidocaine and versed are wearing off. I'm not feeling the greatest.

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2017 04:36PM Radmonkey wrote: Hello... I just had AC #3 on June 21. Definitely more fatigue this round. I will be finishing AC July 5!! My oncologist gave me a choice for my second half: dose dense Taxotere x 4 every 2 weeks or Taxol x 12 every week. My onc says there are more skin side effects associated with dose dense but I would like to be done with chemo in August. Anyone on dose dense? How has the side effects been? Better or worse than AC? Thanks. R

Posts.Content: May 28, 2017 09:59AM Radmonkey wrote: my MO wants me to get blood drawn one week after my AC chemo which was on Wednesday. Then another blood drawn on Monday before my second chemo. Why 2 pokes? Won't I be really neutropenic and susceptible to infection? Can I skip the Wednesday labs??? When are your labs drawn?
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2017 ParakeetsRule notanisland

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2017 09:29AM Radmonkey wrote: notanisland - I think both treatments are equal in fighting breast cancer. I think the weekly taxol have less side effects but are longer. The dose dense have more side effects but is one month less and it's 4 vs 12. I have radiation after chemo so I'm going for dose dense
